page.title: 04HOPS AND CEREALS IN YALDING
page.content: The acreage of hops is being reduced, reflecting the present lack of confidence in the crop. Economic problems and factors in the brewing industry may see the acreage decline further. Conversely the acreage of wheat and barley has increased, the protection afforded by the European Economic Community making them profitable crops. Some straw is harvested and some is burned in situ on the fields. Straw burning, practised by many farmers, is an emotive issue with people. Livestock farming, mainly cattle and sheep, is secondary to other agricultural activities. Market gardening is practised at Kenward, Yalding and Green Farm, Nettlestead. The vineyard at Nettlestead Green is neglected and no longer in production.
